provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4.-(1)  The appointment of every appointed member shall be by of.:
         instrument in writing and shall, subject to the provisions of these
         Regulations, be for a period not exceeding three years.
                 (2) Every appointed member of the Corporation shall be eligible for
         reappointment so, however, that no member shall, at any time, be appointed
         for more than two consecutive terms.
                 (3) Subject to paragraph (4), the Governor-General may at any time
         revoke the appointment of the chairman and any other appointed member if
         he thinks it expedtent so to do.
                (4) Before taking action under paragraph (3) to revoke the
         appointment of a member appointed under regulation 2(3), the Governor-
         General shall consult with the organization or entity which nominated that
         member.
                 (5) If any vacancy occurs in the membership of the Corporation
         such vacancy shall be filled by the appointment of another member who
         shall, subject to the provisions of these Regulations, hold office for the
         remainder of the period for which the previous member was appointed, so,
         hbwever, that the Governor-General shall, before making such appointment,
         consult with the organization or entity which nominated the previous
         member.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. The Governor-General may appoint any person to act temporarily in
         the place of an appointed member in the case of the absence or inability to act
         of that member, after consultation with the organization or entity which
         nominated that member.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.-(1)  Any appointed member, other than the ch;urman,may at any time ~esrsnaum
         resign his office by instnunent in writing addressed to the Governor-General
         and transmitted through the chiurman, and from the date of receipt by the
         Governor-General of such instrument, that appointed member shall cease to
         be a member of the Corporation.
                 (2) The chairman may at any time resign his office by instrument in
         writing addressed to the Governor-General, and such resignation shall take
I-   ,   effect as from the date of receipt by the Governor-General of such

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13.-(1) The Corporatian shall meet at such times as may be necessary z e h
or e w e n t for the transaction of its business and such meetings shall be meems
held at such places and times and on such days as the Corporation may
determine.
        (2) The chairman may at any time call a special meeting of the
Corporahon and shall call a special meeting within seven days of the receipt
of a written request for that purpose addressed to him by two members of the
Corporation.
       (3) The chairman, or in the case of the inability to act of the
chairman, the deputy chairman, shall preside at meetings of the Corporation
and if the chairman or deputy chairman is absent from a meeting the
members present shall elect one of the appointed members to preside at that
meeting.
         (4) The quorum of the Corporation shall be five.
         (5) The decisions of the Corporation shall be by a majority Of votes
and in addition to an original vote the chairman, vice chairman or other
person presiding at a meeting shall have a casting vote in any case in which
the voting is equal.
         (6) Minutes of each meeting of the Corporation shall be kept in
 proper form and shall be confirmed as soon as practicable at a subsequent
 meeting.
         (7) The validity of the proceedings of the Corporation shall not be
 affected by any vacancy amongst the members thereof or by any defect in the
 appointment of the member thereof.
          (8) Subject to the provision of these Regulations. the Corporation
 shall regulate its own proceedings.
